title: A wonderful visit full of nostalgia
text: Both my partner and I had decided to cycle to the Clifton Suspension Bridge. It took us a while and a bit of effort but it was well worth it. When travelling on foot or by bicycle there is no fee to cross the bridge. If you have a car we noted a few spots you could park up and walking on foot to the bridge. The bridge itself was very impressive and worth checking out if in Bristol.

title: A must to visit
text: Honestly, this bridge is an absolute feat of engineering and that‚Äôs before you even get to the time it was built! Parking seemed a little bit difficult (we got really lucky and got one of two spaces right next to it). Really cool place to spend an hour or so walking around and taking photos

title: Amazing views
text: Certainly worth a trip... I cycled across it on a recent tour of Bristol and Glastonbury... certainly recommend as its stunning.

title: Impressive and so peaceful
text: Designed by Brunel in 1835, this bridge is possibly the most iconic sight in Bristol.  It's a toll bridge and a crossing by car costs ¬£1 a go.  You can also cross the bridge on foot (for free), offering great views across the river and Avon Gorge.It's worth climbing up to the Clifton observatory for even better views.

title: Great Example of Victorian Engineering
text: Our Technical Tour guide David Steen was an incredibly informatative and interesting guide. And we loved the stories of Brunel! To go down under the bridge was a huge privilege...

title: A must see when visiting Bristol.
text: Have been wanting to visit this bridge for some time so arranged a few days in Bristol to allow a visit. The bridge itself and the views of it, is brilliant as it spans the Avon Gorge. the river tide was out at our visit but, even so, it was still well worth the visit. Good views from the observatory above the gorge.

title: Walk over the bridge
text: this was something I wanted to do for some time and now I have done it I am planning doing it again, I am organising a trip for club members that wish to share our experience

title: Engineering Marvel..
text: I love it. It's so characteristic. Lovely.Expecially in the night when his lights are all turned on and it shines in the dark.

title: Gorgeous place
text: I was at a meeting nearby at the Engineers House and decided to walk over after work one day.  I‚Äôm glad I did, beautiful views.

title: Great!
text: how this was made is anyone's guess, it's a great example of british engineering at its best - come for the afternoon

title: Incredible history, a masterpiece to be seen
text: ....but don‚Äôt go out of your way! The bridge is, well, a bridge and you can visit the ‚Äòlookout‚Äô for a Birdseye view of the gorge and a climb down to the caves to see the vista from the giants mouth cave, but...this a ‚Äòwhile we‚Äôre there, let‚Äôs do it‚Äô kind of thing. It‚Äôs certainly shouldn‚Äôt be a must do on anyone visiting list.

title: An icon
text: One of the most iconic sites in Bristol designed by Isambard Kingdom Brunel, but completed after his death, and with some changes to his original design.  Look out for differences in the two stone bridge supports - they are not the same.

title: 'Must do' when in Bristol
text: Probably Bristol's most famous landmark, built by the great engineer, Isambard Kingdom Brunel, in 1864, the bridge as amazing to see now as it was then.  It is possible to see it from afar from locations in the city and to visit it, just catch a bus to Clifton.  The bridge allows cars, bikes and pedestrians to cross.  There is a toll for cars, while bikes and pedestrians are free.    If you drive north out of Bristol on the A4 road, you will pass under the bridge.

title: Excellent display and very informative staff
text: The Clifton Suspension Bridge spans the Avon Gorge and the River Avon, linking Clifton in Bristol to Leigh Woods in North Somerset. Opened in 1864, it was built William Henry Barlow and John Hawkshaw, based on an earlier design by Isambard Kingdom Brunel. It is a toll bridge and costs ¬£1 (October 2019) to cross in your car.
